intro: Amphicosmia decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive amphicosmia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, which includes a distinctive arrangement of lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Its botanical significance lies in its ability to mimic other plants, a trait that aids in its survival and ecological interactions. This species is of interest to botanists due to its adaptive features and role in its native ecosystems.
